titleStmt.title: The royall king, and the loyall subject As it hath beene acted with great applause by the Queenes Maiesties Servants. Written by Thomas Heywood.
titleStmt.author: Heywood, Thomas, d. 1641.
Bandello, Matteo, 1485-1561. Novelle. Part 1. Novella 2.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Nich. and Iohn Okes for Iames Becket, and are to be sold at his shop at the inner Temple neare the Gate,

notesStmt.note: A dramatization of William Painter's "Palace of pleasure", tome 2, which is a translation of Matteo Bandello's "Ariabarzane senescalco del re di Persia" from his "Novelle" (part 1, novella 2).
F4 cancellans recto catchword: "That". Variant: with cancellandum F4; recto catchword: "His".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: his shop at the inner Temple neare the Gate
